author: Staff Reporter
text:
The City Municipal Corporation has proposed to borrow Rs. 67.02 crore from Tamil Nadu Urban Finance and Infrastructure Development Corporation (TUFIDCO) for re-laying damaged roads in the city.

The Corporation has planned to re-lay 122.01 km of 293 roads that were damaged during execution of UGD works, Mettur – Salem Dedicated Water Supply Scheme works, and other infrastructure development works.

The total estimated cost is Rs. 74.50 crore and the civic body will contribute Rs. 7.45 crore. The rest will be borrowed from TUFIDCO.

Conditions

In its loan sanction letter, TUFIDCO had laid certain conditions for sanctioning and repayment of loan. It includes collection of property tax of minimum of 65 per cent, professional tax of minimum of 80 per cent and lease collection at a minimum of 60 per cent, collection of user charges for water supply at a minimum of 71 per cent, increasing the annual rental revenue from Rs. 22.81 lakh to Rs. 48.02 lakh during 2016-17. The Corporation has to generate an additional income of Rs. 35.24 crore for 2016-17. The collection of user charges for water supply and UGSS should be a minimum of 55 per cent from 2015-16 and as assured by the Corporation Commissioner, the other income for the year 2016-17 should be minimum of Rs. 109.37 crore.

The Corporation should clear the entire liability of Rs. 60 crore by increasing the revenue and professional tax by 25 per cent of the existing rates, once in every five years from 2018-19 onwards. The Corporation should also give an undertaking that if the increase in property tax and professional tax could not be implemented, the shortfall in any period would not affect the repayment of dues to TUFIDCO.
title: Corporation to borrow Rs. 67 crore for re-laying damaged roads
